result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Devonta R Edwards in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.
Justice point report received and filed.

Defendant Devonta R Edwards in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. This case is being heard for branch 24.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch
 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-17-2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court, defendant Devonta R Edwards not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Devonta R Edwards in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Devonta R Edwards in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised due to lower pending case this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. 

**Defendant may still be in custody for this afternoon's appearance**  Status conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
